file_content.text: [This holoterminal is offline.]
I've returned from Cademimu. What's our status?
With the planetary missile batteries negated, our fleet was able to bombard the planet surface without incident.
The first troops are landing, and the Republic arsenal has been confiscated. The "war chest of the Outer Rim" is no more.
To stand against a planet of enemies... it was a fight worthy of a Sith.
That was exhilarating.
Enjoy your days on the battlefield--they will not last forever.
Missiles and blasters are built to kill soldiers--not Sith.
The Force beats any weapon.
I thought the same, once--I was mistaken.
The Republic military can't be happy--I'm surprised they didn't land troops before we did.
How's the Republic responding?
Their ships were in-system when you took control of the batteries--but they weren't willing to start a war when they knew they'd lose the battle.
Heavy opposition down there. Never conquered a planet before.
That was an interesting job.
If you find it to your taste, consider joining the Imperial military.
How many deaths from the invasion so far?
Give me casualty numbers.
Less than two dozen among our soldiers. The enemy is surrendering en masse; our domination is absolute.
You sound awfully satisfied.
The day's pleasures were not expected.
We've also apprehended Cademimu's governor and scheduled his public execution.
His successor will be given the opportunity to lead the planet into a new era--or else pay for its association with the Republic.
I'm sure you'll put affairs on Cademimu in order.
As you say, my lord.
It would not have been possible without your assistance. Until the next opportunity.
The Cademiman people didn't ask to be part of the Republic, and they didn't ask to secede. Don't punish them for being victims.
Go easy on the civilians.
If they suffer, it is because they choose to be victims. But mindless oppression serves no one.
That should be entertaining.
Not really interested....
In any case, our business is done. Until the next opportunity.
[This holoterminal is offline.]
Lord Malgus. You wish to speak with me?
That's correct.
Cademimu Five is an industrial world used by the Republic as a weapons depot--the so-called "war chest of the Outer Rim."
Now the planetary governor faces charges of corruption and has declared independence rather than stand trial. This is our opportunity.
There's no Republic fleet and no treaty between the Empire and Cademimu.
So Cademimu is unprotected.
Indeed--and they have something we want.
What are the odds of buying the governor's loyalty?
Can we recruit the governor?
Slim, according to his Intelligence profile--the man is a fool and an egotist.
You think this is funny, don't you?
You're enjoying this....
It is a privilege to observe democratic values in action.
If we acquire or eliminate Cademimu's weapon stockpiles, three Republic sectors will be left undefended. Conquering the planet is secondary.
Nonetheless, we must act before Republic troops put down this rebellion--or before the governor readies the Cademiman defenses.
One swift stroke can destroy Cademimu's military strength. They will not be prepared to face Sith.
We deal a crippling blow.
We share a vision, you and I.
So when you thought of taking a planet, you thought of me.
You want my personal touch.
You understand when power must be taken.
I can hit atmosphere within six hours. Have we identified the key defense targets?
We hit fast and hard.
You'll have a full report awaiting you.
You want me to assassinate the governor, or am I taking on a whole planet?
Not sure what the job is.
You will do neither.
What sort of arsenal can the governor access? What are we facing?
Tell me about the weapons.
The stockpile consists of over eighty thousand missiles designed to obliterate capital ships.
We'd need to invade the planet's military center. That's a mission for a full brigade, not a strike team.
Charging in would be suicide.
A brigade would never arrive in time, so you must suffice.
As we speak, the governor is overriding Republic security protocols and arming the planetary missile batteries.
His private army is quelling civilian riots, but the army's elite will protect the missile command center. Push through, take control and Cademimu will be ours.
I'll leave for the planet immediately, Lord Malgus. Be prepared for my signal.
I'll see you when I return.
The fleet is assembling. When you are finished, it will be ready to secure the system.
Assuming we succeed--where does Cademimu go from there?
What happens afterward?
We'll bring a fleet into orbit, and the people's response will determine their fate. Now go.
I have my doubts, but....
Fail, and the Empire loses nothing. Succeed, and we remove one of the enemy's strongest pieces from the board.
[Start Veteran Mode]
[This holoterminal is offline.]
[Start Master Mode]
